meanings.sent1: Her indifferentism towards the outcome of the game was evident.
meanings.sent2: His indifferentism towards politics often left others puzzled.
meanings.sent3: The cat's indifferentism towards the new toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The student's indifferentism towards studying was like a wall blocking his progress.
meanings.sent5: The indifferentism of the audience made the speaker feel invisible.

meanings.definition: A belief that all religions are equally valid or true
meanings.sent1: The concept of indifferentism towards different faiths promotes harmony.
meanings.sent2: His indifferentism led him to explore various religious practices with an open mind.
meanings.sent3: The indifferentism of the philosopher towards religious differences was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: In a world of religious indifferentism, finding one's own path can be challenging.
meanings.sent5: The idea of indifferentism in religion can be both enlightening and controversial.
